intro: Alafia cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf alafia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes plants known for their ornamental and sometimes medicinal uses. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It is often cultivated for its attractive foliage and can thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Alafia cuneata is a perennial herb that prefers partial shade and is commonly found in wetlands and along riverbanks.
